nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.protocol

Interface IProtocol

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    protocol

    public interface IProtocol
    IProtocol is the interface for the Qwirkle Protocol implementation. This interface contains definitions for all commands used in the protocol. An implementation has to be made by the groups themselves.

    Tiles

    Tiles are represented by an integer. There are 6 colors and 6 shapes to be identified, resulting in 36 different combinations. First, we define the colors and shapes as integers from 0 to 5. Using the formula color * 6 + shape we can calculate the integer for the Tile. It does not matter which shape or color is defined by which integer, as long as it is done consistently.

    Changelog

    0.3
    Added nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol#SERVER_PASS
    0.2
    Added nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol#VERSION number
    Changed nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol#CLIENT_IDENTIFY name regex
    Changed nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol#CLIENT_IDENTIFY example
    Renamed COMMAND_NOT_FOUND to nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#INVALID_COMMAND
    Since:
    0.1-w01
    Version:
    0.3
    Author:
    Erik Gaal

    • Field Detail

      • VERSION

        static final java.lang.String VERSION

        String representing the version of the protocol.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_IDENTIFY

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_IDENTIFY

        Sent by the client when connecting to a server to identify itself.

        The player name must match regex ^[a-zA-Z0-9-_]{2,16}$ nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#NAME_INVALID

        The player name must be unique. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#NAME_USED

        Parameters:
        name - name of the player
        features - list of features supported by the client (see nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Feature)
        Example:
        IDENTIFY PlayerA CHAT,LEADERBOARD
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_QUIT

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_QUIT

        Sent by the client when gracefully quitting a game.

        Parameters:
        Example:
        QUIT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_QUEUE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_QUEUE

        Sent by the client to enter a queue for a n-player game.

        The player can queue for 2, 3 or 4 player games. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#QUEUE_INVALID

        Parameters:
        numbers - a list of numbers of players
        Example:
        QUEUE 2,4
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_MOVE_PUT

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_MOVE_PUT

        Sent by the client to put tiles on the board as a move.

        The player must own the tiles.nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#MOVE_TILES_UNOWNED

        The move must be valid. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#MOVE_INVALID

        Parameters:
        tile@x,y - list of tilecode at coordinate
        Example:
        MOVE_PUT 0@0,0 6@0,1 12@0,2
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_MOVE_TRADE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_MOVE_TRADE

        Sent by the client to trade tiles as a move.

        The player must own the tiles. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#MOVE_TILES_UNOWNED

        The deck contain at least as many tiles as traded. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#DECK_EMPTY

        The player cannot trade if the board is empty. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#TRADE_FIRST_TURN

        Parameters:
        tiles - list of tiles
        Example:
        MOVE_TRADE 23 18 7
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_IDENITFY

        Parameters:
        features - list of features
        Example:
        CONNECTOK CHAT,LOBBY

        Example:

      • SERVER_GAMEEND

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_GAMEEND

        Sent by the server to announce a game ending.

        Parameters:
        result - WIN or ERROR
        player - list of player with their score
        Example:
        GAMEEND WIN 11,Alice 13,Bob 17,Carol
        See Also:

        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_PASS

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_PASS

        Sent by the server to announce the turn which is automatically passed.

        The server must send this if the player cannot do a valid move.

        Parameters:
        player - the player
        Example:
        PASS Bob
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_DRAWTILE

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_DRAWTILE

        Sent by the server to draw a player a new tile.

        The server must send this to one player.

        Parameters:
        tiles - list of tiles
        Example:
        DRAWTILE 23 7 19
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Example:
        MOVEOK_PUT 0@0,0 6@0,1 12@0,2

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_MOVE_TRADE

        Sent y the server to confirm trading tiles as a move.

        Parameters:
        amount - amount of tiles traded
        Example:
        MOVEOK_TRADE 3
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_ERROR

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_ERROR

        Sent by the server to indicate an error.

        Parameters:
        code - the error
        [message] - a human readable message
        Example:
        ERROR 1 Invalid move
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_CHAT

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_CHAT

        Sent by the client when chatting.

        The channel must be global or @playername. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#INVALID_CHANNEL

        Parameters:
        channel - the channel
        message - the message
        Example:
        CHAT global Hello world!
        CHAT @Bob Hello Bob!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVER_CHAT

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_CHAT

        Sent by the server to confirm a chat message.

        Parameters:
        channel - the channel
        sender - the sender
        message - the message
        Example:
        CHATOK global Alice Hello world!
        CHATOK @Bob Alice Hello Bob!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_CHALLENGE

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_CHALLENGE

        Parameters:
        player - the player
        Example:
        CHALLENGE Bob
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CLIENT_CHALLENGE_ACCEPT

        static final java.lang.String CLIENT_CHALLENGE_ACCEPT

        Sent by the client to accept a challenge.

        The player must be challenged by the other player beforehand. nl.utwente.ewi.qwirkle.net.IProtocol.Error#NOT_CHALLENGED

        Parameters:
        player - the player
        Example:
        CHALLENGE_ACCEPT Alice
        See Also:

      • SERVER_LEADERBOARD

        static final java.lang.String SERVER_LEADERBOARD

        Sent by the server to transfer the leaderboard.

        How the leaderboard is stored may be decided by the groups themselves. One way is to store the amount of wins and losses.

        Parameters:
        player,wins,losses - list of players with their scores
        Example:
        LEADERBOARDOK Alice,2,1 Bob,0,3 Carol,1,2
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
